intro: Hampea panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian hampea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
